about.description:
Sty's goal is to provide Python with a simple, customizable and
performant string styling markup, which is decoupled from color
palettes and terminal implementations.

Sty's goal is to provide Python with a simple, customizable and
performant string styling markup, which is decoupled from color
palettes and terminal implementations.

name: sty

new_version_errors.1.0.4:
The recipe did not change in the version migration, a URL did not hash, or there is jinja2 syntax the bot cannot handle!

Please check the URLs in your recipe with version '1.0.4' to make sure they exist!

We also found the following errors:

 - could not hash URL template 'https://github.com/feluxe/sty/archive/refs/tags/{{ version }}-rc.2.tar.gz'

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "sty" %}
{% set version = "1.0.0" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://github.com/feluxe/sty/archive/refs/tags/{{ version }}-rc.2.tar.gz
  sha256: 9b18f272adac3778d6157249a50c756b0d65878e2ccd80a151ccd0087fafea92

build:
  noarch: python
  number: 0
  script: "{{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv"

requirements:
  host:
    - python >=3.6
    - pip
    - toml
    - setuptools
  run:
    - python >=3.6

test:
  imports:
    - sty
  requires:
    - pip
  commands:
    - pip check

about:
  home: https://sty.mewo.dev/
  license: Apache-2.0
  license_family: Apache
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: 'String styling for your terminal.'
  description: |
    Sty's goal is to provide Python with a simple, customizable and
    performant string styling markup, which is decoupled from color
    palettes and terminal implementations.
  doc_url: https://sty.mewo.dev
  dev_url: https://github.com/feluxe/sty

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - jan-janssen
